meanings.definition: An alternative plan or course of action that can be taken if the original plan fails.
meanings.sent1: When the first plan didn't work, they had to rely on the fallback.
meanings.sent2: Having a fallback strategy is important in case things go wrong.
meanings.sent3: The team's fallback was to order pizza if the cooking failed.
meanings.sent4: The fallback of using a map saved them when the GPS stopped working.
meanings.sent5: Always have a fallback ready in case your main idea doesn't succeed.

meanings.definition: To resort to a fallback option in case of failure.
meanings.sent1: If the main solution fails, they will fallback to plan B.
meanings.sent2: It's wise to fallback on simpler methods when the complex one doesn't work.
meanings.sent3: She had to fallback on her old phone when the new one broke.
meanings.sent4: In tough times, we often have to fallback on our instincts to survive.
meanings.sent5: Don't be afraid to fallback on your experience when facing challenges.
